@graph.name: Vegan Black Bean Brownies - Vegan Heaven
@graph.description: These vegan black bean brownies are not only super delicious, fudgy, and chocolatey but also gluten free. Plus the recipe couldn't be easier!

@graph.headline: Vegan Black Bean Brownies
@graph.keywords: bean brownies recipe,black bean brownies,easy brownies,gluten free black bean brownies,vegan and gluten free black bean brownies,vegan brownies

@graph.name: Vegan Black Bean Brownies
@graph.description: For 9 large brownies. I used a 9 x 8 inches baking tray.

recipeInstructions.text: Thoroughly rinse and drain the black beans. Grind the flax seeds in a food processor or use store-bought ground flax seeds. Whisk them together with 8 tablespoons of water and set aside to thicken for about 2 minutes.. Then make the batter: Combine all ingredients except the chocolate chips and the walnuts in a food processor and process until smooth (also add the soaked flax seeds).
recipeInstructions.name: Thoroughly rinse and drain the black beans. Grind the flax seeds in a food processor or use store-bought ground flax seeds. Whisk them together with 8 tablespoons of water and set aside to thicken for about 2 minutes.. Then make the batter: Combine all ingredients except the chocolate chips and the walnuts in a food processor and process until smooth (also add the soaked flax seeds).

recipeInstructions.text: Lightly grease a baking tray and pour in the batter. Add the chocolate chips and spread evenly. Sprinkle with the chopped walnuts.
recipeInstructions.name: Lightly grease a baking tray and pour in the batter. Add the chocolate chips and spread evenly. Sprinkle with the chopped walnuts.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for about 40 minutes. Allow the brownies to cool down before you cut them into pieces.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for about 40 minutes. Allow the brownies to cool down before you cut them into pieces.
